intro: Filago gallica var. multicaulis, commonly known as the many-stemmed filago, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with multiple stems arising from the base. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
